intro: Hypochaeris thrincioides, commonly known as the common hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom from spring to early summer, followed by small, spherical seed heads. Hypochaeris thrincioides is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
